content:
Diagnosis:	Cholangiocarcinoma, Stage IVA with widespread lymphadenopathy

Management:	2023 Nov - Commenced Gemcitabine/Cisplatin
		2024 Jan - Changed to Pembrolizumab monotherapy (PDL1 TPS 90%)

Histology:	Moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma of biliary tract origin

Current Situation:	Cycle 4 Pembrolizumab review

I reviewed [redacted name] today for assessment prior to cycle 4 of pembrolizumab. Recent CT imaging from 15/3/24 shows stable disease with no new sites of disease and slight reduction in size of porta hepatis nodes (previously 3.2cm, now 2.8cm). The mediastinal and retroperitoneal nodes remain unchanged. Liver function tests have normalized with bilirubin now 15 and ALT 42.

She is tolerating immunotherapy well with only grade 1 fatigue and occasional mild arthralgia. No features of immune-related adverse events. Performance status remains 1. Weight is stable at 68kg.

On examination, there is no clinical evidence of disease progression. Mild peripheral edema noted but no other new findings.

The plan is to continue with pembrolizumab today. Next CT scan will be due after cycle 6. We will review her again in 3 weeks with blood tests including TFTs and cortisol. She understands to contact us if any new symptoms develop, particularly those suggestive of immune-related toxicity.
